_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
Bonjour Tremblant!


The mountain is simply spectacular this morning. Conditions are at their peak!

Several natural-snow trails now offer an authentically smooth ride, the progression park is getting ready for a refined opening with perfectly shaped features, and outdoor enthusiasts can already enjoy alpine touring in the North–South, Grand North, and Timber Tour areas.

 Suit up in your warmest gear and get ready to experience skiing at its finest. The mountain is waiting! 

Please also note that, due to ongoing snowmaking, conditions may vary and visibility is reduced in certain areas. We encourage you to exercise extra caution during your runs so you can fully enjoy your day on the mountain safely.
Important: there is no ski-out on the South side. The descent to the base will be exclusively via the Gondola.

Have a wonderful day!

 Mountain safety tip of the week: Please observe the signage.

Snow fall is recorded daily at 5 a.m from mid-mountain at North Side (550 m / 1,800 ft). This data, based on 24 hours, provides a picture of on-mountain conditions. Actual accumulation may differ from the official report. Be aware of changing conditions. Lifts and trails exist in a mountain environment and may close due to weather, usage and/or special maintenance.
_inspectorSnowReport.Alert:
Alpine Touring is open!

The trails Nord-Sud, Grand Nord and Tour du Timber are open to Alpine Touring adepts! Have fun!
_inspectorSnowReport.SafetyReport:
﻿Bonjour Tremblant!
This Tuesday, four alpine-touring trails and the Progression park are open, as well as a few addtionnal runs that will open throughout the day. Please stay aware of signage, follow trail guidelines, and enjoy the slopes responsibly!

Please note: no ski-out to the South Side base— the return will be via the Gondola.
_inspectorSnowReport.SafetyReportFrench:
Bonjour Tremblant !
Ce mardi, nous avons quatre sentiers de randonnée alpine et le parc Progression ouverts, ainsi que quelques pistes supplémentaires qui ouvriront au cours de la journée. Veuillez porter attention à la signalisation, respecter les directives des pistes et profiter des descentes de façon responsable !

À noter : il n’y a pas de ski-out vers la base du versant Sud; le retour se fera via la Télécabine.
